clinical_study.brief_title: Loco/Regional Anaesthesia Evaluation in Laparoscopic Hernioplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Loco/Regional Anaesthesia Evaluation in Laparoscopic Hernioplasty

brief_summary.textblock: Laparoscopic hernioplasty is associated with lesser postoperative pain and quick return to work. TAP block is the gold standard technique in this type of hernioplasty. Our aim is to compare TAP block with a novel local infiltration technique that uses direct laparoscopical vision.

detailed_description.textblock: Laparoscopic hernioplasty is associated with lesser postoperative pain and quick return to work. TAP block is the gold standard technique in this type of hernioplasty. Our aim is to compare TAP block with a novel local infiltration technique that uses direct laparoscopical vision. Patients will be randomized into two arms of intervention that will be compared by a blind analysis. Primary outcomes will be postoperative pain evaluated systematically until 30 days postoperative, and analgesic consumption.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Each patient will be included in one cohort of treatment by a randomized criteria.

primary_outcome.description: Postoperative main measured by an visual analogue scale

secondary_outcome.measure: pain at the moment of need of analgesics take
secondary_outcome.description: pain measured at the analgesic consumption

arm_group.description: Local analgesic infiltration in the mesh fixation site

intervention.description: Local analgesic infiltration in the mesh fixation site

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or more.
- Programmed inguinal laparoscopic hernioplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergic to medication prescribed
- Story of mesh rejection
